title.narrative: Ceara Rural Sustainable Development and Competitiveness Phase II

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to enhance access to markets and access to water and sanitation, adopting climate resilient approaches, by targeted beneficiaries in selected areas of the State of Ceará.

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section I, A, 2: The Borrower shall create no later than three months after the Effective Date and thereafter maintain,at all times during the implementation of the Project, the UGP to carry out the Project coordination, management, planning,monitoring and evaluation with sufficient resources, decision making capacity, competent staff in adequate numbers andresponsibilities, all acceptable to the Bank and as set forth in the Operational Manual.

Schedule 2, Section I, A, 3: The Borrower shall create no later than one month after the Effective Date and thereafter maintain, atall times during the implementation of the Project, the Steering Committee, with representatives of all entities involved inProject implementation, with regular meetings and sufficient resources, all acceptable to the Bank and as set forth in theOperational Manual.

title.narrative: Communities supported by the water supply activities submitted for registration in SIASAR
Farmers reached with agricultural assets or services
Increase gross value of sales (in real terms) by members of organizations participating in approved subprojects
Water supply systems (WSS) implemented/rehabilitated in operation
People provided with access to improved sanitation services
Households with water reuse systems implemented for agricultural production
Beneficiaries trained in support of subproject implementation
Subprojects for strengthening organizations for enhanced market access and enabling sustainability
Implemented technologies and/or hydro-environmental activities to improve the efficiency and/or resilience of the system
Subprojects for social and productive inclusion of vulnerable groups
Trained youth by capacity building activities under the project
Household sanitary kit implemented (new kit and/or treatment)
Beneficiaries'organizations strengthening existing market and/or accessing new marketing channels (either private and/or public markets)
Beneficiaries satisfied with productive investments and water & sanitation access
People provided with access to improved water sources
Staff trained from SDA and project's strategic partner institutions
Complaints and inquiries received through the Grievance Redress Mechanism that are registered and addressed
EMATERCE restructuring model designed and implemented
Female family farmers supported by productive subprojects reducing the difference in the gross sales value of those obtained by men
Women reducing time (hours per week) dedicated to household chores
Farmers reached with agricultural assets or services - Female
